meanings.sent1: She can manipulate the clay into beautiful shapes.
meanings.sent2: He knows how to manipulate the tools to fix the car.
meanings.sent3: The magician can manipulate objects in surprising ways.
meanings.sent4: Her fingers seem to manipulate the piano keys effortlessly.
meanings.sent5: Watch closely as he manipulates the strings of the puppet.

meanings.definition: Influence or control in a clever or unscrupulous way
meanings.sent1: The politician's manipulative tactics were exposed.
meanings.sent2: She saw through his manipulative behavior and stayed cautious.
meanings.sent3: The manipulative salesman tried to convince her to buy unnecessary items.
meanings.sent4: His manipulative ways eventually led to his downfall.
meanings.sent5: Beware of the manipulative intentions behind his friendly smile.

meanings.definition: Alter or present (data) in a way that is misleading
meanings.sent1: They tried to manipulate the statistics to show false results.
meanings.sent2: It is unethical to manipulate data to support a biased argument.
meanings.sent3: The student tried to manipulate the experiment results to impress the teacher.
meanings.sent4: The company was caught manipulating financial records to deceive investors.
meanings.sent5: Be careful not to manipulate the evidence to fit your theory.
